definition: to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to get hyped up in front of an audience/(of children) to play up in front of guests
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
to get drunk and act crazy/roaring drunk
variant of 風癱|风瘫[feng1 tan1]

sentences.english: "Be clean!" And immediately the leprosy left him.
sentences.chinese: 大麻疯立刻就离了他的身。

sentences.english: The only explanation for his behavior is that hes mad.
sentences.chinese: 对他的行为的唯一解释是他疯了。
我知道，这听起来真是疯了。

sentences.english: I am nearly driven mad by this condition.
sentences.chinese: 我几乎被这种状况搞得疯了。

sentences.english: No, I was not mad, just slow to catch up with my life's 2)revisions.
sentences.chinese: 不，我没疯，只是没跟上世道的变化罢了。

sentences.english: "This is tearing people apart, " said Minnewaukan Mayor Trish McQuoid, fighting back tears.
sentences.chinese: 密尼沃坎镇长麦阔伊德含泪说，这把人们都逼疯了。

sentences.english: "People who think this are crazy, " Fallows wrote on his blog.
sentences.chinese: 这样想的人简直是疯了。

sentences.english: I kept crashing into things, a little crazy, I guess.
sentences.chinese: 我总是东跌西撞的，我想自己一定是疯了。

sentences.english: This last year has been busy and the amount of grey in my hair has progressed rapidly, too.
sentences.chinese: 去年真的很忙，我那些个白发也疯一般长出来了。

sentences.english: and finding somewhere to go, but not really going that crazy.
sentences.chinese: 找地方走走，但不会玩得很疯。

sentences.english: You must be absolutely crackers even to think of it.
sentences.chinese: 你绝对是疯了，那东西是连想都不能想的。

sentences.english: Everywhere you looked, books of prophecy were selling like crazy.
sentences.chinese: 无论你朝哪儿看，都会发现预言书已经卖疯了。

sentences.english: Small wonder the stone men go mad.
sentences.chinese: 这也不奇怪石人们都疯了。
你疯了似地拓展你的交际网。

sentences.english: Why does this fellow send someone to me to be cured of his leprosy?
sentences.chinese: 这人竟打发人来，叫我治好他的大麻疯。

sentences.english: Are such people completely nuts, throwing away good money just to show off?
sentences.chinese: 这些人完全疯了么，把大把的钱扔出去只为了炫耀？

definition: to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
out of control/berserk/to go for a long walk
to flip out/to act out violently
to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
